Name: Cylindrical Kohl Stick
Description: The small cylindrical stick is used for applying kohl, an eye paint that enhances beauty and protects the eyes. The stick was originally much longer. The top of the stick is shaped like a papyrus flower. The papyrus is decorated with geometric designs. On top of the papyrus flower, there is the tiny figure of a man walking. The man's head is shaven, the ears are large and protruding, and the belly thrusts outward. He is wearing a long, tight kilt. The detailed features of this tiny figure, which include the eyes, lips, cartilage of the ears, pectorals, the folds at the neck, and the twists of the kilt, were remarkably executed.
